title: (x) Honey font ID? / thin casual connected script - Stobart {Marcel B}
content:
Hi guys,

I could do with this font for the word honey being identified, looks like a handwritten/ script font! Many thanks in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018070026im_/http:/typophile.com/files/3e0d1e06119168319a71ff2586c3ba7bf1a4db7d_m_6538.jpg)
author: Pabs69

comments.content: These logos tend to be hand made. Look at the different height of the line where the letters connect. It would require a sophisticated glyph substitution algorithm to do that with a font.
Another, maybe not As playful but has some similar characteristics is [Miss Robertson](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018070026/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/sudtipos/miss_robertson/)

It's called Stobart by Protimient (Ben Jones) and is a lovely script font based on the characters written in a letter by Mr Henry Stobart, dated 1899. More at the designer site: [http://www.protimient.com/thefonts.php?font=stobart](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018070026/http:/www.protimient.com/thefonts.php?font=stobart "http://www.protimient.com/thefonts.php?font=stobart") or at [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/protimient/stobart/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018070026/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/protimient/stobart/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/protimient/stobart/")

Hi Marcel,  
welcome to Typophile!  
Good find, much appreciated.

Florian
